document.discussion_title: Close Brothers Group plc’s (CBG) “Buy” Rating Reiterated at Numis Securities Ltd
document.topic_text: Tweet Numis Securities Ltd reiterated their buy rating on shares of Close Brothers Group plc (LON:CBG) in a research note released on Wednesday morning. The brokerage currently has a GBX 1,551 ($19.97) price objective on the stock. Shares of Close Brothers Group plc ( LON:CBG ) opened at 1353.00 on Wednesday. The stock’s market cap is GBX 2.01 billion. Close Brothers Group plc has a 1-year low of GBX 975.00 and a 1-year high of GBX 1,569.00. The stock has a 50 day moving average of GBX 1,219.13 and a 200 day moving average of GBX 1,245.42. CBG has been the subject of several other research reports. Royal Bank Of Canada cut shares of Close Brothers Group plc to an underperform rating and reduced their target price for the stock from GBX 1,450 ($18.67) to GBX 1,300 ($16.74) in a research note on Tuesday, April 26th. Barclays PLC upgraded shares of Close Brothers Group plc to an overweight rating and set a GBX 1,300 ($16.74) price objective for the company in a research note on Thursday, June 30th. Peel Hunt reiterated a buy rating and issued a GBX 1,600 ($20.60) price objective on shares of Close Brothers Group plc in a research note on Wednesday, July 20th. Shore Capital reiterated a hold rating on shares of Close Brothers Group plc in a research note on Friday, May 20th. Finally, Liberum Capital reiterated a buy rating and issued a GBX 1,184 ($15.25) price objective on shares of Close Brothers Group plc in a research note on Thursday, July 21st. One analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating, five have issued a hold rating and five have issued a buy rating to the stock. The company currently has a consensus rating of Hold and a consensus target price of GBX 1,442.56 ($18.58). In other news, insider Hodges,Stephen R purchased 40,000 shares of the stock in a transaction dated Monday, June 27th. The stock was acquired at an average cost of GBX 1,084 ($13.96) per share, for a total transaction of £433,600 ($558,331.19). Close Brothers Group plc is a United Kingdom-based merchant banking company. The Company provides lending, deposit taking, wealth management services and securities trading. The Company operates through three divisions: banking, which provides a range of lending products to the United Kingdom small and medium enterprises (SMEs), as well as installment payment solutions to the United Kingdom retail borrowers; securities, which provides dealing and execution services to financial institutions through Winterflood, and asset management, which provides wealth management service for individuals, incorporating both financial planning advice and investment management.
